name: Dratini

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: It is called the "Mirage Pokémon" because so few have seen it. Its shed skin has been found.

name: Dratini

attacks.name: Hypnotic Gaze
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: It is called the "Mirage Pokémon" because so few have seen it. Its shed skin has been found.

name: Dragonair

attacks.name: Dragon Pulse
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your deck.

flavorText: If its body takes on an aura, the weather changes instantly. It is said to live in seas and lakes.

name: Dragonair

attacks.name: Healing Melody
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: If its body takes on an aura, the weather changes instantly. It is said to live in seas and lakes.

name: Dragonite

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hurricane Tail
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: It is said to make its home somewhere in the sea. It guides crews of shipwrecks to shore.

name: Bagon
flavorText: Dreaming of one day flying, it practices by leaping off cliffs every day.

name: Shelgon

attacks.name: Knock Away
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: Within its rugged shell, its cells have begun changing. The shell peels off the instant it evolves.

name: Salamence

abilities.name: Scornful Storm
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may have your opponent discard cards from his or her hand until he or she has 4 cards left in his or her hand.

attacks.name: Shred
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: As a result of its long-held dream of flying, its cellular structure changed, and wings grew out.

name: Latias

attacks.name: Energy Assist
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sky Heal
attacks.text: If Latios is on your Bench, heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: Its body is covered in a down that can refract light in such a way that it becomes invisible.

name: Latios

attacks.name: Sky Blade
attacks.text: If Latias is on your Bench, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: A highly intelligent Pokémon. By folding back its wings in flight, it can overtake jet planes.

name: Rayquaza

attacks.name: Dragon Pulse
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your deck.

attacks.name: Shred
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: It lives in the ozone layer far above the clouds and cannot be seen from the ground.

name: Axew

attacks.name: Signs of Evolution
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for Fraxure, reveal it, and put it into your hand, Shuffle your deck afterward.

flavorText: They use their tusks to crush the berries they eat. Repeated regrowth makes their tusks strong and sharp.

name: Axew

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: They mark their territory by leaving gashes in trees with their tusks. If a tusk breaks, a new one grows in quickly.

name: Fraxure

abilities.name: Grit
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, each of its attacks does 40 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: Since a broken tusk will not grow back, they diligently sharpen their tusks on river rocks after they've been fighting.

name: Fraxure
flavorText: Their tusks can shatter rocks. Territory battles between Fraxure can be intensely violent.

name: Haxorus

attacks.name: Axe Slugger
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Colorless Pokémon, this attack does 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Dragon Pulse
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your deck.

flavorText: They are kind but can be relentless when defending territory. They challenge foes with tusks that can cut steel.

name: Druddigon

attacks.name: Tight Jaw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Dragon Tail
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 80 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: It races through narrow caves, using its sharp claws to catch prey. The skin on its face is harder than a rock.

name: Exp. Share
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
When your Active Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, you may move 1 basic Energy card that was attached to that Pokémon to the Pokémon this card is attached to.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: First Ticket
rules: Before you flip a coin to decide who goes first in a game, you may play this card. Don't flip that coin, and you go first. If both players play First Ticket, flip the coin as normal. (You may play only 1 First Ticket before you flip that coin.)
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Super Rod
rules: Shuffle 3 in any combination of Pokémon and basic Energy cards from your discard pile back into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Kyurem

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: It can produce ultracold air. Its body is frozen.
